posts.title: Hard Cider and Fermentation
posts.subtitle: Turn fresh cider into an alcoholic beverage
posts.description:
We will cover the basics of turning apple cider (and other fruit juices) into an alcoholic drink. Works great with fresh cider from the Eleventh Annual Hacksburg Cider Making!

This class is for attendees age 21 and up. No underage class attendees permitted.

posts.title: 11th Annual Cider Making
posts.subtitle: Fresh, all-natural, and delicious!
posts.description:
Come to Hacksburg with apples and you'll be able to make your own cider! The best kind of apples to bring is a variety; using only one type typically results in cider that is extremely sweet or tart. Ten pounds of apples makes about three quarts of cider. Free for everyone in the community, no RSVP required.

For more information, visit Hacksburg's Cider Making page.

All ages are welcome at this event. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times.

posts.title: 11th Annual Cider Making
posts.subtitle: Fresh, all-natural, and delicious!
posts.description:
Come to Hacksburg with apples and you'll be able to make your own cider! The best kind of apples to bring is a variety; using only one type typically results in cider that is extremely sweet or tart. Ten pounds of apples makes about three quarts of cider. Free for everyone in the community, no RSVP required.

For more information, visit Hacksburg's Cider Making page.

All ages are welcome at this event. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times.

posts.title: Resin Printing Basics
posts.subtitle: Learn to use Hacksburg's 8K SLA resin printer
posts.description:
Normal filament-based 3D printers are capable of making an incredible array of parts, but for high-detail miniatures our resin printer is capable of over 10x the resolution. Learn how to use the Hacksburg resin printer, what parts work best, and how these machines differ from filament-based printers.

This workshop covers resin selection, print preparation, support generation, post-processing techniques including washing and curing, and safety procedures for handling liquid resin. Perfect for miniature gaming, jewelry making, or any application requiring fine detail.

Ages 16+. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times.

posts.title: Intro to FreeCAD
posts.subtitle: Design and prepare models for 3D printing
posts.description:
Learn the fundamentals of FreeCAD, a powerful open-source parametric 3D modeling tool that delivers professional-grade design capabilities without the professional-grade price tag. This class will guide you through FreeCAD's interface and workflow to create your first 3D models, with a focus on designing for 3D printing.

We'll cover essential concepts including sketching, constraints, feature-based modeling, and preparing models for printing with proper tolerances and support structures. Bring a laptop with FreeCAD installed!

posts.title: Basics of LEDs
posts.subtitle: Light up your projects with modern LED technology
posts.description:
Illuminate your understanding of LED technology with this comprehensive introduction to light-emitting diodes. You'll learn about different types of LEDs, proper circuit design, current limiting resistors, and basic control methods including switches, potentiometers, and microcontrollers.

Beyond the basics, we'll dive into LED specifications, color theory, and practical applications. Attendees will also learn how to use addressable RGB LEDs to create dynamic lighting effects. Perfect for anyone interested in electronics, art installations, or adding lighting to maker projects.

posts.title: Casual Coppersmithing
posts.subtitle: Experience the redsmith's ancient craft
posts.description:
Join us for an immersive journey into the ancient craft of coppersmithing! In this hands-on workshop, you'll transform salvaged copper pipe into a striking copper cuff bracelet, shaping your own hand-worked treasure.

We'll demonstrate the value and advantage of using reclaimed materials and teach you the essential skills to create functional and decorative items using copper. You'll also learn the rich history of the craft as it developed over millennia.

By the end of the workshop, you'll leave with with a personalized copper bangle and the skills and knowledge to continue exploring coppersmithing on your own.

posts.title: Tabletop Terrain
posts.subtitle: Paint shaped foam and 3D prints to create realistic tabletop props
posts.description:
This workshop combines multiple techniques including hot wire foam cutting, FDM 3D printing, and advanced painting methods to craft realistic landscapes, buildings, and props for RPGs, wargames, and board games.

Learn how to use hot wire foam cutters to shape terrain features, optimize 3D printer settings for high detail parts, and apply layered painting techniques including dry brushing, washing, and weathering effects. Attendees will complete at least one terrain piece to take home.

Perfect for D&D dungeon masters, Warhammer players, or anyone looking to enhance their tabletop gaming setup!

posts.title: Vacuum Forming
posts.subtitle: Shape plastic sheets into 3D molds
posts.description:
Learn the fundamentals of vacuum forming, a versatile manufacturing process that uses heat and vacuum pressure to shape plastic sheets into custom molds. This workshop will cover material selection, design considerations, and proper vacuum forming procedures.

Attendees will create their own vacuum formed molds using objects from Hacksburg's workshop. Perfect for prototyping, custom enclosures, or creating unique plastic parts for your projects.

posts.title: Laser Cutter 101
posts.subtitle: Learn to use Hacksburg's laser cutter
posts.description: This workshop covers the Hacksburg 80W CO2 laser cutter. Basic laser safety, design guidelines, and examples will be presented. Attendees will learn how to make their own edge-lit acrylic sign and receive an LED base with the optional materials fee.

posts.title: Hacksburg Open House
posts.subtitle: Tour our community workshop
posts.description:
Hacksburg is a non-profit Makerspace located in Blacksburg, VA. For over 10 years, we've helped creatives and entrepreneurs in the New River Valley complete projects that would otherwise be out of reach. Whether you need equipment, mentorship, or just a place to work, Hacksburg is an accessible, collaborative resource where you can build anything from rockets to robots to rocking chairs.

Hacksburg members must be 18+, but all ages are welcome at this open house. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times.

posts.title: Model Airplane Day
posts.subtitle: Trace the history of handmade aviation
posts.description:
Learn about aerodynamics, construction techniques, and flight adjustments as you build and launch your own miniature flying machine. A rubber band-powered, propeller-driven kit is provided with the optional materials fee, but we'll also fire up Hacksburg's laser cutter to craft ultra-precise paper airplanes (inspired by The Great International Paper Airplane Book) and demonstrate 3D printed, hand-powered helicopters and pull copters!

Whether you're reliving childhood memories or experiencing the joy of handmade flight for the first time, this workshop promises hours of engineering fun culminating in a friendly flying competition.

posts.title: Vinyl Cutting
posts.subtitle: Stickers, labels, clothing, and more
posts.description:
This workshop covers the Hacksburg vinyl cutter. Basic safety, design guidelines, and examples will be presented. Attendees will learn how to make their own vinyl sticker or shirt with the optional materials fee.

Free for members and $5 for non-members, plus $5 optional materials fee. Bring your own 100% cotton t-shirt if you want to make a custom shirt!

Ages 14+, Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent or guardian at all times.

posts.title: Building Personal Websites
posts.subtitle: Rediscover the freedom and creativity of hand-crafted web development
posts.description:
Carve out your own corner of the Internet by building a personal website from scratch! This back-to-basics workshop celebrates the DIY spirit of the early web, with a focus on the fundamental building blocks of HTML and CSS.

You'll learn how to write your first lines of code and publish your site on the World Wide Web, with plenty of guidance and inspiration along the way. Build a blog, photo gallery, interactive art piece, band page, or a delightfully weird personal site that's uniquely you.

No coding experience necessary. Bring a laptop and sign up for a GitHub account before class.

posts.title: Embroidery 101
posts.subtitle: Custom garments with robotic sewing machines
posts.description:
Learn how to use a CNC embroidery machine to add custom shapes, logos, and text to items! This class will cover how to program designs using open source software.

Free for members and $5 for non-members, plus $5 optional materials fee. Bring your own shirt!

Ages 14+, Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent or guardian at all times.

posts.title: Foam Smithing - Cosplay 101
posts.subtitle: Transform foam into armor and props with Hacksburg's award-winning cosplayer!
posts.description:
This introductory workshop demystifies the art of foam smithing - a cornerstone technique for creating lightweight, durable, and detailed costume pieces without breaking the bank. We'll discuss essential skills including pattern making, cutting techniques, heat forming, surface texturing, and finishing methods that elevate simple foam sheets into convention-worthy creations.

Whether you're preparing for your first cosplay or looking to level up your existing skills, this class provides the foundation for bringing your favorite characters and original designs to life through the versatile medium of foam.

posts.title: Hacksburg Open House
posts.subtitle: Tour our Community Workshop
posts.description:
Hacksburg is a non-profit Makerspace located in Blacksburg, VA. For over 10 years, we've helped creatives and entrepreneurs in the New River Valley complete projects that would otherwise be out of reach. Whether you need equipment, mentorship, or just a place to work, Hacksburg is an accessible, collaborative resource where you can build anything from rockets to robots to rocking chairs.

Hacksburg members must be 18+, but all ages are welcome at this open house. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times.

posts.title: Hacksburg at Summer Solstice Fest
posts.subtitle: The summer festival for locals
posts.description:
Hacksburg will be exhibiting at the Downtown Blacksburg Summer Solstice Fest.

Come out and enjoy hands-on activities, locally made products for sale, food trucks, live music, and more!

This event is free and family friendly. Learn more at downtownblacksburg.com.

posts.title: Resin Printing Basics
posts.subtitle: Learn to use Hacksburg's 8K SLA resin printer
posts.description:
Normal filament-based 3D printers are capable of making an incredible array of parts, but for high-detail miniatures our new resin printer is capable of over 10x the resolution. Learn how to use the Hacksburg resin printer, what parts work best, and how these machines differ from filament-based printers. The class is free for Hacksburg members and $5 for non-members.

This class is for attendees age 16 and up. If you are bringing an attendee under 18, you (the parent/guardian) must stay for the entire duration of the class and approve all equipment use.

posts.title: Woodblock Printing
posts.subtitle: The ancient artform, reimagined with modern maker tools
posts.description:
In this hands-on workshop, you'll use a variety of pre-carved woodblocks to create your own fine art prints using Hacksburg's printing press. We'll discuss traditional hand carving techniques and demonstrate contemporary examples created using Hacksburg's laser cutter and CNC mill.

You'll also learn how to prepare designs for carving, apply ink correctly, and use both machine and manual printing methods, including hand printing with a baren.

By the end of the class, you'll take home your own handcrafted prints and the skills to continue this versatile art form on your own.

posts.title: Podcasting 101
posts.subtitle: Find your voice and share it with the world
posts.description:
Ready to launch your podcast? This comprehensive introduction will equip you with everything you need to know about creating engaging audio content. You'll learn how to use Hacksburg's professional 4-microphone podcast kit while exploring the entire process from concept to publication.

We'll cover selecting compelling topics, structuring episodes, recording techniques, basic editing workflows, and distribution options. During the class, participants will collaborate on a demo recording using our professional equipment, giving you real experience before you begin your own podcasting journey.

posts.title: Wind Chime Making
posts.subtitle: Craft your own metallic melody maker
posts.description:
Create a handcrafted metal wind chime in this hands-on workshop! Participants will learn to use Hacksburg's metal shop equipment including the metal lathe, bandsaw, polishing booth, and drill press to fashion and finish their own small wind chimes.

This class will cover metal selection, cutting techniques, surface finishing, and proper assembly for optimal sound quality. Unlike traditional hollow pipe chimes, these smaller windchimes use thin metal rods to produce a delicate twinkling sound that will bring serenity to your porch, garden, or any other space.

posts.title: Laser Cutter 101: Mother's Day Edition
posts.subtitle: Learn to use Hacksburg's laser cutter
posts.description: This workshop covers the Hacksburg 80W CO2 laser cutter. Basic laser safety, design guidelines, and examples will be presented. Attendees will learn how to make their own edge-lit acrylic sign and receive an LED base with the optional materials fee.

posts.title: Make the Fourth: Star Wars Day + Open House
posts.subtitle: Lightsabers, learning, and maker lore
posts.description:
Join us for a special Star Wars-themed open house as we celebrate May the 4th at Hacksburg! Tour our community workshop and discover how our equipment and resources can help bring your creative projects to life. Throughout the day, we'll showcase member-built lightsabers with demonstrations of their construction techniques, sound systems, and illumination methods.

Star Wars cosplay is enthusiastically encouraged! Come dressed as your favorite character (or one you've created yourself) and connect with fellow makers and fans. Whether you're interested in electronics, 3D printing, woodworking, or just want to see what Hacksburg is all about, this open house offers something for everyone.

posts.title: Intro to FreeCAD
posts.subtitle: Design and prepare models for 3D printing
posts.description:
Learn the fundamentals of FreeCAD, a powerful open-source parametric 3D modeling tool that delivers professional-grade design capabilities without the professional-grade price tag. This class will guide you through FreeCAD's interface and workflow to create your first 3D models, with a focus on designing for 3D printing.

We'll cover essential concepts including sketching, constraints, feature-based modeling, and preparing models for printing with proper tolerances and support structures. Bring a laptop with FreeCAD installed!

posts.title: Retro Systems Workday
posts.subtitle: They aren't old... they're "vintage"
posts.description:
Step back in time for a journey through computing history! In this hands on event, we'll work together to restore an IBM PS/2 Model 25 and experience classic computing firsthand on a fully functional Macintosh Plus from 1986. Whether you're a seasoned tech enthusiast or just curious about these pioneering machines, there's something here for everyone – create a MacPaint masterpiece, surf the World Wide Web, or try your hand at The Oregon Trail (dysentery not guaranteed, but highly likely).

Have a vintage computer of your own? Feel free to bring it along for troubleshooting help or just to show it off!

posts.title: Seed Starting and Gardening Basics
posts.subtitle: Grow your own food at home
posts.description:
Get ready for garden season by learning how to start your own plants from seed. Starting from seed saves money and increases the variety of plants you can grow! This class will also cover basic garden prep information such as mixing soil and making planters.

The optional materials fee includes a starting kit and seeds. Feel free to bring your own seeds as well!

posts.title: Metal Casting
posts.subtitle: Pour molten aluminum
posts.description:
Make your own sand cast aluminum object at our casting class! Sand casting is an exciting process that's very accessible to the hobbyist. Ages 16 and up; wear all cotton clothes and long pants.

If you have something wood or 3D printed that you'd like to cast, bring it along! If it's a complicated shape, you may want to talk to us first. Feel free to email board@hacksburg.org with questions.

posts.title: Intro to Woodturning on the Lathe
posts.description:
Learn the basics of woodturning! This class will cover the tools and techniques of using a wood lathe. Optional materials fee includes wood to make a small project.

Ages 16+. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent or guardian at all times.

posts.title: Silicone Mold Making and Casting
posts.description: This class will showcase some of the knowledge we gained during the initial COVID-19 pandemic response to make PPE for local groups. We will discuss how to make low-cost silicone molds for cosplay, rapid prototyping, and other applications. Attendees will be able to make a silicone mold and produce a wax replica. Ages 14+.

posts.title: Woodworking 101
posts.subtitle: Make sawdust (and a wooden box) in Hacksburg's woodshop
posts.description:
Attendees will have the opportunity to make a simple wooden box with handles and a lid. This project is designed to utilize almost all of the woodworking tools Hacksburg offers and provide a great introduction to woodworking.

To cover the cost of wood, this class will include a $30 materials fee.

Ages 16+. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent or guardian at all times.

posts.title: Laser Cutter 101: Make a DIY Valentines Day Gift
posts.subtitle: Learn to use Hacksburg's laser cutter
posts.description: This workshop covers the Hacksburg 80W CO2 laser cutter. Basic laser safety, design guidelines, and examples will be presented. Attendees will learn how to make their own edge-lit acrylic sign and receive an LED base with the optional materials fee.

posts.title: Intro to CNC Machining
posts.subtitle: Learn to use Hacksburg's CNC gantry router
posts.description:
Attendees will learn how to do basic CNC operations and think like a machinist. Details will be given for the operation of the Hacksburg CNC gantry router, generously donated by Onefinity and Torc Robotics, and we will show the machining of a demo part.

If you would like to become CNC trained as a Hacksburg member, we will schedule a second session to cover CNC programming on the computer.

Ages 14+. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times.

posts.title: Leatherworking Basics
posts.subtitle: Learn how to make long-lasting leather goods
posts.description:
Discover the art of leatherworking and create your own long-lasting leather goods! This comprehensive class will cover the entire leatherworking process, from selecting the right leather and planning your project to cutting, sewing, molding, decorating, and finishing your piece. Attendees will make at least one project (either a cell phone holster or a decorative drink coaster) and may have the opportunity to complete both if time permits.

Ages 16+. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times and parent/guardian must approve all shop tool use.

posts.title: Intro to Electronics: Build your own Radio
posts.subtitle: Learn circuits, soldering, and RF
posts.description:
Build your own working radio in this hands-on class! Attendees will work in small groups to learn the fundamentals of circuit design and soldering while exploring how sound travels through electromagnetic waves. We'll also touch on digital data transmission technologies like Wi-Fi and Bluetooth, providing a foundation for further learning.

Ages 14 and up. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times.

Note: The radio constructed in this class will differ from the one pictured here.

posts.title: Maple Syrup Making
posts.subtitle: How sweet it is
posts.description:
Learn about maple syrup production and everything you need to know to turn sap into syrup at home! Attendees will learn three key aspects: how to identify and tap trees, the various types of equipment needed, and the techniques for boiling and finishing sap into syrup. We'll also talk about the history of maple syrup and maple sugar, syrups from other trees, and explore creative uses of syrup beyond traditional breakfast dishes.

Class fee includes demonstrations, a sampling of local syrup, and supplies to get you started at home!

posts.title: 3D Printer Community Work Day
posts.subtitle: Level up your printer's potential
posts.description:
Got a 3D printer and have questions? Something doesn't work? Want to make your printer harder, better, faster or stronger? This event offers a shared work day for community members to work on and improve our 3D printers. All knowledge levels welcome. Bring your printer!

This class is for attendees age 16 and up. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times.

posts.title: Modern Kites
posts.subtitle: The sky's the limit
posts.description:
These aren’t just for the beach! Learn how modern kites are designed and constructed using advanced materials. Stunt kites, kiteboarding, and even kite photography will be discussed.

This event is for all ages. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times.

posts.title: Sixth Annual Holiday Ornaments
posts.subtitle: Happy Holidays to all the Makers
posts.description:
Join Hacksburg for a festive and family-friendly DIY workshop session where makers of all ages can make their own personalized gifts including laser cut felt Christmas ornaments, custom laser cut wooden displays and cards, and hand polished metal wind chimes.

This event is free, but donations to cover material costs are greatly appreciated!

posts.title: CNC Machining Vacuum Forms
posts.subtitle: Learn to use Hacksburg's CNC gantry router
posts.description:
Attendees will learn how to do basic CNC operations and think like a machinist. Details will be given for the operation of the Hacksburg CNC gantry router, generously donated by Onefinity and Torc Robotics. We will be machining forms for use with the vacuum former during next week's class.

This class is for attendees age 16 and up. If you are bringing an attendee under 18, you (the parent/guardian) must stay for the entire duration of the class and approve all shop tool use.

posts.title: Metal Casting
posts.subtitle: Pour molten aluminum
posts.description:
Make your own sand cast aluminum object at our casting class! Sand casting is an exciting process that's very accessible to the hobbyist. Ages 16 and up; wear all cotton clothes and long pants.

If you have something wood or 3D printed that you'd like to cast, bring it along! If it's a complicated shape, you may want to talk to us first. Feel free to email board@hacksburg.org with questions.

posts.title: Fermentation: Hard Cider & Homebrewing Basics
posts.subtitle: Intro to Homebrewing
posts.description:
We will cover the basics of turning apple cider (and other fruit juices) into an alcoholic drink. Works great with fresh cider from the Tenth Annual Hacksburg Cider Making!

This class is for attendees age 21 and up. No underage class attendees permitted.

posts.title: Tenth Annual Hacksburg Cider Making
posts.subtitle: Fresh, all-natural, and delicious!
posts.description:
Come to Hacksburg with apples and you'll be able to make your own cider! The best kind of apples to bring is a variety; using only one type typically results in cider that is extremely sweet or tart. Ten pounds of apples makes about three quarts of cider. Free for everyone in the community, no RSVP required.

For more information, visit Hacksburg's Cider Making page.

All ages are welcome at this event. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times.

posts.title: Tenth Annual Hacksburg Cider Making
posts.subtitle: Fresh, all-natural, and delicious!
posts.description:
Come to Hacksburg with apples and you'll be able to make your own cider! The best kind of apples to bring is a variety; using only one type typically results in cider that is extremely sweet or tart. Ten pounds of apples makes about three quarts of cider. Free for everyone in the community, no RSVP required.

For more information, visit Hacksburg's Cider Making page.

All ages are welcome at this event. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times.

posts.title: Maple Tree Identification Walk
posts.description:
Prepare for maple syrup season by learning how to identify the many varieties of maple trees. Although maple tapping takes place in the winter, maple trees are most easily identified in the fall due to their distinct, vibrant leaves!

This event is free for members and non-members!

posts.title: Laser Taco Tuesday
posts.subtitle: It's a fiery fiesta
posts.description:
Customize your Taco Tuesday experience by laser engraving your tortilla on Hacksburg's 80W CO2 laser cutter! Tortillas and fillings will be provided, bring your own tortilla design ideas.

This is a family friendly event. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian for the full duration of the event, and parent/guardian must approve all equipment use.

This event is free, but donations to cover ingredients are appreciated!

posts.title: Designing Circuit Boards in KiCad
posts.subtitle: Open source software for PCB design
posts.description:
Learn how to design your own circuit boards using KiCad, a free software suite for electronic design automation. We will cover the use of the software to design a custom circuit and how to have it manufactured.

Please bring a computer for the hands-on portion of the class!

Free for members and $5 for non-members.

Ages 16+. Attendees under the age of 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times.

posts.title: Lunar Eclipse Watch Party
posts.description:
Join Hacksburg members to watch a partial lunar eclipse. Members will bring telescopes, binoculars, and cameras to observe the eclipse.

Please note, this is NOT a total eclipse. Only a small bite (about 9%) of the moon will be covered!

  • Begins: 10:12:58 pm
  • Maximum: 10:44:18 pm
  • Ends: 11:15:38 pm

posts.title: Resin Printer Basics
posts.subtitle: Learn to use Hacksburg's 8K SLA resin printer
posts.description:
Normal filament-based 3D printers are capable of making an incredible array of parts, but for high-detail miniatures our new resin printer is capable of over 10x the resolution. Learn how to use the Hacksburg resin printer, what parts work best, and how these machines differ from filament-based printers. The class is free for Hacksburg members and $5 for non-members.

This class is for attendees age 16 and up. If you are bringing an attendee under 18, you (the parent/guardian) must stay for the entire duration of the class and approve all equipment use.

posts.title: Laser Cutter 101
posts.subtitle: Make your own edge-lit acrylic sign
posts.description:
This workshop covers the Hacksburg 80W CO2 laser cutter. Basic laser safety, design guidelines, and examples will be presented. Attendees will learn how to make their own edge-lit acrylic sign and receive an LED base with the optional materials fee.

This class is free for members and $5 for non-members, plus an optional $10 materials fee.

posts.title: Metal Casting
posts.subtitle: Pour molten aluminum
posts.description:
Make your own sand cast aluminum object at our casting class! Sand casting is an exciting process that's very accessible to the hobbyist. Ages 16 and up; wear all cotton clothes and long pants.

If you have something wood or 3D printed that you'd like to cast, bring it along! If it's a complicated shape, you may want to talk to us first. Feel free to email board@hacksburg.org with questions.

posts.title: Canning Basics
posts.subtitle: You can do it!
posts.description:
Canning is a method of preserving food that can extend the shelf life of a variety of foods, even vegetables from your own garden. This class covers canning for beginners. Discussion time will be included for your own specific canning questions and to learn what others are canning.

This class is for attendees age 12 and up. The class is free for Hacksburg members and $5 for non-members. If you are bringing an attendee under 18, you (the parent/guardian) must stay for the entire duration of the class.

posts.title: CNC Machining - Part 2
posts.subtitle: CAM and G-code generation
posts.description:
Attendees will learn CAM programming, which converts a 3d model into machine commands. Attendees will receive remote access to our CAM computer and a homework assignment, in the form of a STEP file that you will generate a machining plan and gcode for. You will then execute the plan, with me or another Hacksburg member, to confirm your ability to do CAM programming and CNC machining.

The class is free for Hacksburg members and $5 for non-members. This class is for attendees age 16 and up. If you are bringing an attendee under 18, you (the parent/guardian) must stay for the entire duration of the class and approve all shop tool use.

posts.title: Embroidery 101
posts.subtitle: Custom garments with robotic sewing machines
posts.description:
Learn how to use a CNC embroidery machine to add custom shapes, logos, and text to items! This class will cover how to program designs using open source software.

Free for members and $5 for non-members, plus $5 optional materials fee. Bring your own shirt!

Ages 14+, Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent or guardian at all times.

posts.title: Vinyl Cutting
posts.subtitle: Stickers, labels, clothing, and more
posts.description:
This workshop covers the Hacksburg vinyl cutter. Basic safety, design guidelines, and examples will be presented. Attendees will learn how to make their own vinyl sticker or shirt with the optional materials fee.

Free for members and $5 for non-members, plus $5 optional materials fee. Bring your own 100% cotton t-shirt if you want to make a custom shirt!

Ages 14+, Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent or guardian at all times.

posts.title: Smart Home with Home Assistant
posts.subtitle: Open the pod bay doors, HA
posts.description:
Smart outlets and home automation are becoming more popular every year, but these devices are often lacking some advanced features and have undesirable connections to the Internet. In this class we'll show you how to take control of your own smart outlets using software like ESPHome and Home Assistant. Bring your own Raspberry Pi or use one of our demo setups.

Old laptops work really well for Home Assistant too! Make sure it has an Ethernet port.

Event fee of $5 for non-members and free for Hacksburg members.

posts.title: CNC Machining - Part 1
posts.subtitle: Learn to use Hacksburg's CNC gantry router
posts.description:
Attendees will learn how to do basic CNC operations and think like a machinist. Details will be given for the operation of the Hacksburg CNC gantry router, generously donated by Onefinity and Torc Robotics, and we will show the machining of a demo part. Feel free to attend only this first part.

If you intend on getting CNC trained as a Hacksburg member, we will schedule a time to hold Part 2, where I will teach the CAM programming on the computer and give you remote access to our CAM computer. You will then receive a homework assignment, in the form of a STEP file that you will generate a machining plan and gcode for. You will then execute the plan, with me or another Hacksburg member, to confirm your ability to do CAM programming and CNC machining.

The class is free for Hacksburg members and $5 for non-members. This class is for attendees age 16 and up. If you are bringing an attendee under 18, you (the parent/guardian) must stay for the entire duration of the class and approve all shop tool use.

posts.title: Laser Cutter 101
posts.subtitle: Make your own edge-lit acrylic sign
posts.description:
This workshop covers the Hacksburg 80W CO2 laser cutter. Basic laser safety, design guidelines, and examples will be presented. Attendees will learn how to make their own edge-lit acrylic sign and receive an LED base with the optional materials fee.

This class is free for members and $5 for non-members, plus an optional $10 materials fee.

posts.title: Homebrewing 101
posts.subtitle: Brew your own beer
posts.description:
We will cover the basics of homebrewing, including equipment, supplies, and techniques. We will demonstrate the extract brewing process and discuss the all-grain/mash process. The class will also touch on wine/cider/mead making techniques.

This class is for attendees age 21 and up. The class is free for Hacksburg members and $5 for non-members. No underage class attendees permitted.

posts.title: Hacksburg Open House
posts.subtitle: Tour our community workshop
posts.description:
Hacksburg is a non-profit Makerspace located in Blacksburg, VA. For over 10 years, we've helped creatives and entrepreneurs in the New River Valley complete projects that would otherwise be out of reach. Whether you need equipment, mentorship, or just a place to work, Hacksburg is an accessible, collaborative resource where you can build anything from rockets to robots to rocking chairs.

Hacksburg members must be 18+, but all ages are welcome at this open house. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times.

posts.title: Hacksburg at Summer Solstice Fest
posts.subtitle: The summer festival for locals
posts.description: Hacksburg will be exhibiting at the Downtown Blacksburg Summer Solstice Fest. Come out and enjoy hands-on activities, locally made products for sale, food trucks, live music, and more! This event is free and family friendly. Learn more at downtownblacksburg.com.

posts.title: Resin Printer Basics
posts.subtitle: Learn to use Hacksburg's 8K SLA resin printer
posts.description:
Normal filament-based 3D printers are capable of making an incredible array of parts, but for high-detail miniatures our new resin printer is capable of over 10x the resolution. Learn how to use the Hacksburg resin printer, what parts work best, and how these machines differ from filament-based printers. The class is free for Hacksburg members and $5 for non-members.

This class is for attendees age 16 and up. If you are bringing an attendee under 18, you (the parent/guardian) must stay for the entire duration of the class and approve all equipment use.

posts.title: Woodworking 101
posts.subtitle: Introduction to wood tools
posts.description:
Attendees will have the opportunity to make a simple wooden box. The project is designed to utilize almost all of the woodworking tools Hacksburg offers and provide a great introduction to woodworking.

Ages 16+, Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent or guardian at all times.

posts.title: Introduction to Holograms
posts.subtitle: Make your own 3D image
posts.description:
Learn about lasers and how a hologram captures details of light to make your own hologram. Bring a small object or scene about the size of a business card. Shiny finishes should be avoided where possible. White or grey objects work well, but you can also do colored objects like M&M's.

Visit litiholo.com to view examples.

$15 for members and $20 for non-members to cover hologram materials.

Ages 16+. Attendees under the age of 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times.

posts.title: Designing Circuit Boards in KiCad
posts.subtitle: Open source software for PCB design
posts.description:
Learn how to design your own circuit boards using KiCad, a free software suite for electronic design automation. We will cover the use of the software to design a custom circuit and how to have it manufactured.

Please bring a computer for the hands-on portion of the class!

Free for members and $5 for non-members.

Ages 16+. Attendees under the age of 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times.

posts.title: Modern Kites
posts.subtitle: Kites aren't just for the beach
posts.description:
Learn how modern kites are designed and constructed using advanced materials. Stunt kites, kiteboarding, and even kite photography will be discussed.

All ages. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times.

posts.title: Hacksburg 10th Anniversary Open House
posts.subtitle: A Decade of Community Making
posts.description:
Hacksburg's workshop opened for the first time on March 30, 2014. Since then we've enabled hundred of makers, artists, and entrepreneurs in the New River Valley to complete projects that would otherwise be out of reach.

We will be celebrating the anniversary with tours of our workshop and hands on projects to commemorate the event!

Hacksburg members must be 18+, but all ages are welcome at this open house. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times.

posts.title: 10th Anniversary Weekly Meeting
posts.subtitle: A Decade of Community Making
posts.description: The Hacksburg workshop opened for the first time on March 30, 2014. At this week's meeting, we will be celebrating Hacksburg's history, inviting founding members, and looking forward to the future!

posts.title: Hacksburg at Maker Faire Lynchburg
posts.subtitle: Making is better together
posts.description:
Hacksburg will be exhibiting at Maker Faire Lynchburg. Come out and enjoy hands-on activities, amazing exhibits, locally made products for sale, food trucks, a group build project and more!

This event is free and family-friendly. There will be activities for kids as young as 4, plus fun for grown-up makers too.

More info at Maker Faire Lynchburg.

posts.title: Seed Starting and Gardening Basics
posts.subtitle: Colorless green ideas sleep furiously
posts.description:
Get ready for garden season by learning how to start your own plants from seed. Starting from seed saves money and increases the variety of plants you can grow! This class will also cover basic garden prep information such as mixing soil and making planters.

The class fee includes a starting kit and seeds. Feel free to bring your own seeds as well!

posts.title: Bicycle Repair Day
posts.subtitle: Get your bike ready for spring!
posts.description:
Hacksburg will host a work session to provide help with basic bicycle repair and maintenance. Hacksburg will supply space, tools, cleaners and lubricants; attendees will provide bicycles.

Ages 14+. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times.

posts.title: 3D Printer Community Work Day
posts.subtitle: Make your printer harder, better, faster, stronger!
posts.description:
Got a 3D printer and have questions? Something doesn't work? Want to make your printer harder, better, faster or stronger? This event offers a shared work day for community members to work on and improve our 3D printers. All knowledge levels welcome. Bring your printer!

Instructions on how to customize and compile firmware for your 3D printer will also be presented.

This class is for attendees age 16 and up. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times.

posts.title: Intro to Woodturning on the Lathe
posts.description:
Learn the basics of woodturning! This class will cover the tools and techniques of using a wood lathe.

Free for members and $5 for non-members, plus $15 optional materials fee.

Ages 16+, Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent or guardian at all times.

posts.title: CNC Machining
posts.description:
Attendees will learn how to do basic CNC operations and think like a machinist. Details will be given for the operation of the Hacksburg CNC gantry router, generously donated by Onefinity and Torc Robotics, and we will show the machining of a demo part. Feel free to attend only this first part.

Ages 16+, Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent or guardian at all times.

posts.title: Laser Cutter 101: Make a DIY Valentines Day Gift
posts.subtitle: Learn to use Hacksburg's laser cutter
posts.description:
This workshop covers the Hacksburg 80W CO2 laser cutter. Basic laser safety, design guidelines, and examples will be presented. Attendees will learn how to make their own edge-lit acrylic sign and receive the LED base with the optional materials fee.

Free for members and $5 for non-members, plus $10 optional materials fee.

posts.title: Woodworking 101
posts.subtitle: Introduction to wood tools
posts.description:
Attendees will have the opportunity to make a simple wooden box. The project is designed to utilize almost all of the woodworking tools Hacksburg offers and provide a great introduction to woodworking.

Ages 16+, Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent or guardian at all times.

posts.title: Intro to Electronics with Radios
posts.subtitle: Learn circuits, soldering, and RF
posts.description: In this class, attendees will build radios in groups while learning the basics of how sound is transmitted using electromagnetic waves. Digital data transmission (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, etc) will be surveyed with enough information to ignite future learning. Ages 14+.

posts.title: Metal Casting
posts.subtitle: Pour molten aluminum
posts.description:
Make your own sand cast Aluminum object at our casting class! Sand casting is an exciting process that's very accessible to the hobbyist. Ages 16 and up; wear all cotton clothes and long pants.

If you have something wood or 3D printed that you'd like to cast, bring it along! If it's a complicated shape, you may want to talk to us first. Feel free to email board@hacksburg.org with questions.

posts.title: Sewing 101
posts.subtitle: A stitch in time saves nine
posts.description:
Learn the basics of sewing using the sewing machines at Hacksburg. Attendees will make a basic project (likely a pillow case).

Ages 14+, Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent or guardian at all times.

posts.title: Maple Syrup Making
posts.subtitle: How sweet it is
posts.description:
Learn about maple syrup production and everything you need to know to turn sap into a syrup at home! We will learn about how to identify and tap trees, different kinds of equipment and techniques for boiling and finishing into syrup. We'll also talk about the history of maple syrup and maple sugar, syrups from other trees, and how syrup is not just good on pancakes!

Class fee includes demonstrations, a sampling of local syrup, and supplies to get you started at home!

posts.title: Smart Home Alone!
posts.description:
Smart outlets and home automation are becoming more popular every year, but these devices are often lacking some advanced features and have undesirable connections to the Internet. In this class we'll show you how to take control of your own smart outlets using software like ESPHome and Home Assistant. Bring your own Raspberry Pi or use one of our demo setups.

Old laptops work really well for Home Assistant too! Make sure it has an Ethernet port.

Event fee of $5 for non-members and free for Hacksburg members.

posts.title: Metal Casting
posts.subtitle: Pour molten aluminum
posts.description:
Make your own sand cast Aluminum object at our casting class! Sand casting is an exciting process that's very accessible to the hobbyist. Ages 16 and up; wear all cotton clothes and long pants.

If you have something wood or 3D printed that you'd like to cast, bring it along! If it's a complicated shape, you may want to talk to us first. Feel free to email board@hacksburg.org with questions.

posts.title: Fifth Annual Holiday Ornaments
posts.subtitle: Happy Holidays to all the Makers
posts.description:
Join Hacksburg for a festive and family-friendly DIY workshop session where makers of all ages can make their own personalized gifts including laser cut felt Christmas ornaments, custom laser cut wooden displays and cards, and hand polished metal wind chimes.

The event is free, but donations to cover material costs are greatly appreciated!

posts.title: Resin Printer Basics
posts.subtitle: Learn to use Hacksburg's 8K SLA resin printer
posts.description:
Normal filament-based 3D printers are capable of making an incredible array of parts, but for high-detail miniatures our new resin printer is capable of over 10x the resolution. Learn how to use the Hacksburg resin printer, what parts work best, and how these machines differ from filament-based printers. The class is free for Hacksburg members and $5 for non-members.

This class is for attendees age 16 and up. If you are bringing an attendee under 18, you (the parent/guardian) must stay for the entire duration of the class and approve all equipment use.

posts.title: Sewing 101
posts.subtitle: With a sewing machine!
posts.description: Learn the basics of sewing using the sewing machines at Hacksburg. Attendees will make a basic project (likely a pillow case). This class is for ages 14 and up. The class is free for Hacksburg members and $5 for non-members.

posts.title: Hacksburg Halloween
posts.subtitle: 👻 Get your spook on 🎃
posts.description:
Show off your coolest costume at the weekly meeting, bonus points for DIY! Bring a (small) pumpkin and get it laser engraved on Hacksburg's laser cutter.

Join online at meet.hacksburg.org/OpenGroupMeeting

No RSVP required!

posts.title: Fermentation and Hard Cider Basics
posts.subtitle: Intro to Homebrewing
posts.description:
We will cover the basics of turning apple cider (and other fruit juices) into an alcoholic drink. Works great with fresh cider from the Ninth Annual Hacksburg Cider Making!

This class is for attendees age 21 and up. No underage class attendees permitted.

posts.title: Intro to Solar Power
posts.subtitle: Clean energy from the sun
posts.description:
A group discussion of solar power from grid-scale, to rooftop, to portable and how you can get started.

Join online at meet.hacksburg.org/OpenGroupMeeting

Mini-classes are shorter 30-90 minute casual events held after the weekly meeting. They may introduce a new topic, expand on a previous class, or be a forum for discussion. No RSVP required!

posts.title: Ninth Annual Hacksburg Cider Making
posts.subtitle: Fresh, all-natural, and delicious!
posts.description:
Come to Hacksburg with apples and you'll be able to make your own cider! The best kind of apples to bring is a variety; using only one type typically results in cider that is extremely sweet or tart. Ten pounds of apples makes about three quarts of cider. Free for everyone in the community, no RSVP required.

For more information, visit Hacksburg's Cider Making page.

All ages are welcome at this event. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times.

posts.title: Ninth Annual Hacksburg Cider Making
posts.subtitle: Fresh, all-natural, and delicious!
posts.description:
Come to Hacksburg with apples and you'll be able to make your own cider! The best kind of apples to bring is a variety; using only one type typically results in cider that is extremely sweet or tart. Ten pounds of apples makes about three quarts of cider. Free for everyone in the community, no RSVP required.

For more information, visit Hacksburg's Cider Making page.

All ages are welcome at this event. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times.

posts.title: Apple Grinder Prep
posts.subtitle: Apples go brrr
posts.description:
Help replace the motor on Hacksburg's apple grinder in preparation for cider making.

No RSVP required!

posts.title: Working with LEDs
posts.subtitle: Give your costume a glow-up
posts.description:
Learn about the types of LED lights and how to integrate them into costumes and cosplay.

Join online at meet.hacksburg.org/OpenGroupMeeting

Mini-classes are shorter 30-90 minute casual events held after the weekly meeting. They may introduce a new topic, expand on a previous class, or be a forum for discussion. No RSVP required!

posts.title: 3D Printer Community Work Day
posts.subtitle: Make your printer harder, better, faster, stronger!
posts.description:
Got a 3D printer and have questions? Something doesn't work? Want to make your printer harder, better, faster or stronger? This event offers a shared work day for community members to work on and improve our 3D printers. All knowledge levels welcome. Bring your printer!

Instructions on how to customize and compile firmware for your 3D printer will also be presented.

This class is for attendees age 16 and up. If you are bringing an attendee under 18, you (the parent/guardian) must stay for the entire duration of the class.

posts.title: Costume and Cosplay Tips and Tricks
posts.subtitle: Prep for spook season 🎃
posts.description:
Ask questions and get advice on your costumes from Hacksburg's award winning instructor. This is a casual, unstructured discussion, so please bring your costumes and questions!

Event takes place online only.

Open for ages 12+. If you are bringing an attendee under 18, you (the parent/guardian) must stay for the entire duration of the class.

posts.title: Photogrammetry
posts.subtitle: 3D scans from your camera
posts.description:
A group discussion of the tools and techniques for photogrammetry, a method of extracting 3D information from photographs.

Join online at meet.hacksburg.org/OpenGroupMeeting

Mini-classes are shorter 30-90 minute casual events held after the weekly meeting. They may introduce a new topic, expand on a previous class, or be a forum for discussion. No RSVP required!

posts.title: Animation in Blender
posts.subtitle: Pixels, Shapes, and Motion
posts.description:
Learn the basics of the award-winning open source 3D design and animation software Blender. Attendees will learn how to compose scenes, animate objects, create materials and textures, and render a final scene. This class will focus on learning the software, as opposed to the artistic aspect of 3D animation.

Ages 14+. Minors will need to have parent/guardian supervision for the entire duration of the class.

posts.title: Maple Tree Identification Walk
posts.description: Prepare for Maple syrup season by learning how to identify the many varieties of maple trees. Although maple tapping takes place in the winter, maple trees are most easily identified in the fall due to their distinct, vibrant leaves!

posts.title: Laser Cutter 101
posts.subtitle: Make Your Own Edge-Lit Acrylic Sign
posts.description:
This workshop covers the Hacksburg 80W CO2 laser cutter. Basic laser safety, design guidelines, and examples will be presented. Attendees will learn how to make their own edge-lit acrylic sign and receive the LED base with the optional materials fee.

Free for members and $5 for non-members, plus $10 optional materials fee.

This event has been rescheduled.

posts.title: DIY Home Maintenance
posts.subtitle: Was that hole always there?
posts.description:
Learn how to perform basic home repairs and maintenance. Will cover preventative items as well as repairs including: minor drywall patching, unclogging a drain, fixing a leaking faucet or toilet and more.

If there is a specific repair or maintenance item you would like to see, please let us know!

$5 for members and $10 for non-members.

posts.title: Laser Taco Tuesday
posts.subtitle: It's a fiery fiesta
posts.description:
Customize your Taco Tuesday experience by laser engraving your tortilla on Hacksburg's 80W CO2 laser cutter! Tortillas and fillings will be provided, bring your own tortilla design ideas.

This class is for ages 16 and up. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian for the full duration of the class, and parent/guardian must approve all equipment use.

This event is free, but donations to cover ingredients are appreciated!

posts.title: Hacksburg Open House
posts.subtitle: Part of Game Changer Week
posts.description:
Hacksburg is a non-profit Makerspace located in Blacksburg, VA. Started in 2014, we're a community workshop focused on enabling creatives and entrepreneurs in the New River Valley to complete projects that would otherwise be out of reach. Whether you need equipment, mentorship, or just some space to work, Hacksburg is meant to be an accessible, collaborative, and affordable resource for building anything from rockets to robots to rocking chairs.

Hacksburg members must be 18+, but all ages are welcome at this open house. If you are bringing attendees under 18, you (parent/guardian) must stay for the duration of the class.

posts.title: Intro to CNC Machining
posts.subtitle: Learn to use Hacksburg's CNC gantry router
posts.description:
In part one of our series of CNC classes, attendees will learn how to do basic CNC operations and think like a machinist. Details will be given for the operation of Hacksburg's CNC gantry router, generously donated by Onefinity and Torc Robotics, and we will machine a demonstration part.

This class is for ages 16 and up. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian for the full duration of the class, and parent/guardian must approve all equipment use.

posts.title: Canning Basics
posts.subtitle: You can-can do it!
posts.description:
Canning is a method of preserving food that can extend the shelf life of a variety of foods, even vegetables from your own garden. This class covers canning for beginners. Discussion time will be included for your own specific canning questions and to learn what others are canning.

This class is for attendees age 12 and up. If you are bringing an attendee under 18, you (the parent/guardian) must stay for the entire duration of the class.

posts.title: Forest Maintenance Discussion
posts.description:
Participate in a group discussion about forest maintenance.

Join online at meet.hacksburg.org/OpenGroupMeeting

Mini-classes are shorter 30-90 minute casual events held after the weekly meeting. They may introduce a new topic, expand on a previous class, or be a forum for discussion. No RSVP required!

posts.title: Animation in Blender
posts.subtitle: Pixels and Shapes
posts.description:
Learn the basics of the award-winning open source 3D design and animation software Blender. Attendees will learn how to compose scenes, animate objects, create materials and textures, and render a final scene. This class will focus on learning the software, as opposed to the artistic aspect of 3D animation.

Ages 14+. Minors will need to have parent/guardian supervision for the entire duration of the class.

posts.title: E-Commerce Mini-class
posts.description:
Explore your options for collecting money on a website. Attendees will discuss their experiences and best practices for e-commerce.

Join online at meet.hacksburg.org/OpenGroupMeeting

Mini-classes are shorter 30-90 minute casual events held after the weekly meeting. They may introduce a new topic, expand on a previous class, or be a forum for discussion. No RSVP required!

posts.title: Basic Web Development
posts.subtitle: That's what spiders do, right?
posts.description:
Want to set up your own website? Learn the basics of HTML, CSS, and Javascript in order to create a custom website. Hosting will be discussed, including the special options available to Hacksburg members.

Ages 16+. Minors will need to have parent/guardian supervision for the entire duration of the class.

posts.title: Intro to Slide Rules Mini-class
posts.description:
Learn how to use a slide rule to perform calculations, no electronics required! Slide rules will be provided for a hands-on demonstration, feel free to bring your own.

Join online at meet.hacksburg.org/OpenGroupMeeting

Mini-classes are shorter 30-90 minute casual events held after the weekly meeting. They may introduce a new topic, expand on a previous class, or be a forum for discussion. No RSVP required!

posts.title: Using AI Tools Mini-class
posts.description:
Learn how to access and use AI tools including chatbots and image generators. Will also discuss limitations and risks of these tools. Bring a computer!

Join online at meet.hacksburg.org/OpenGroupMeeting

Mini-classes are shorter 30-90 minute casual events held after the weekly meeting. They may introduce a new topic, expand on a previous class, or be a forum for discussion. No RSVP required!

posts.title: Intro to Programming with Python
posts.subtitle: Learn the basics of the Python programming language
posts.description:
Attendees will learn the basics of the Python programming language. Python is an exciting programming language which enables you to program anything from smart light bulbs to the world's largest supercomputers.

Laptop required. Ages 14+, If you are bringing an attendee under 18, the parent/guardian must stay for the entire duration of the class.

posts.title: Future Aerial Transport Mini-class
posts.description:
A time to discuss concepts in future aerial transportation including personal aircraft, alternative fuels, and more!

Join online at meet.hacksburg.org/OpenGroupMeeting

Mini-classes are shorter 30-90 minute casual events held after the weekly meeting. They may introduce a new topic, expand on a previous class, or be a forum for discussion. No RSVP required!

posts.title: Bicycle Repair Day
posts.subtitle: Two wheels good!
posts.description:
Have a bike that needs work? Hacksburg will host a work session to provide help with basic bicycle repair and maintenance. Hacksburg will supply space, tools, cleaners and lubricants; attendees will provide bicycles and spare parts.

Ages 14+, If you are bringing an attendee under 18, the parent/guardian must stay for the entire duration of the class and approve all shop tool use.

posts.title: Working with Stepper Motors Mini-class
posts.description:
Learn how stepper motors work, why you would want to use them, and how to add them to your projects.

Join online at meet.hacksburg.org/OpenGroupMeeting

Mini-classes are shorter 30-90 minute casual events held after the weekly meeting. They may introduce a new topic, expand on a previous class, or be a forum for discussion. No RSVP required!

posts.title: 3D Printer Community Work Day
posts.subtitle: Make your printer harder, better, faster, stronger!
posts.description:
Got a 3D printer and have questions? Something doesn't work? Want to make your printer harder, better, faster or stronger? This event offers a shared work day for community members to work on and improve our 3D printers. All knowledge levels welcome. Bring your printer!

Ages 16+, If you are bringing an attendee under 18, the parent/guardian must stay for the entire duration of the class.

posts.title: Leatherworking Basics
posts.subtitle: Learn how to make long-lasting leather goods
posts.description:
Today, most leather hides are discarded and completely wasted, but you can still make many useful things, like shoes, belts, bags, and clothing from leather. This class will cover selecting leather, project planning, cutting, sewing, molding, decoration, and finishing. Attendees can make a cell phone holster or/and a decorative drink coaster, as time permits.

Ages 16+, If you are bringing an attendee under 18, the parent/guardian must stay for the entire duration of the class and approve all shop tool use.

posts.title: Hacksburg Open House
posts.subtitle: Tour our Community Workshop
posts.description:
Hacksburg is a non-profit Makerspace located in Blacksburg, VA. Started in 2014, we're a community workshop focused on helping creatives and entrepreneurs in the New River Valley complete projects that would otherwise be out of reach. Whether you need equipment, mentorship, or just a place to work, Hacksburg is an accessible, collaborative, and affordable resource where you can build anything from rockets to robots to rocking chairs.

Hacksburg members must be 18+, but all ages are welcome at this open house. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all times.

posts.title: Hacksburg at Summer Solstice Fest
posts.subtitle: The summer festival for locals
posts.description: Hacksburg will be exhibiting at the Downtown Blacksburg Summer Solstice Fest. Come out and enjoy hands-on activities, locally made products for sale, food trucks, live music, and more! This event is free and family friendly. Learn more at downtownblacksburg.com.

posts.title: Modern Kites
posts.subtitle: These aren't just for the beach!
posts.description:
Learn how modern kites are designed and constructed using advanced materials. Stunt kites, kiteboarding, and even kite photography will be discussed.

This event is open to all ages, but attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian for the full duration of the class.

posts.title: Modifying CAD
posts.subtitle: Learn to modify existing models for 3D printing
posts.description:
There are an incredible variety of 3D models available online for 3D printers. But what if you need to change something about a model to suit your needs? In this class, you'll learn basic and advanced techniques for modifying 3D models.

This class is intended for ages 16 and up, but younger attendees with 3D printing experience are welcome if you confirm with the board ahead of time (board@hacksburg.org). Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian for the full duration of the class.

posts.title: Building Radios
posts.subtitle: A hands-on lesson in electromagnetism
posts.description: In this class, attendees will build radios in groups while learning the basics of how sound is transmitted using electromagnetic waves. Digital data transmission (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, etc) will be surveyed with enough information to ignite future learning. Ages 14+.

posts.title: Resin Printing Basics
posts.subtitle: Learn to use Hacksburg's 8K SLA resin printer
posts.description:
Filament-based 3D printers are capable of making an incredible array of parts, but, for high-detail miniatures, our new resin printer is capable of over 10x the resolution. In this class, you'll learn how to use Hacksburg's resin printer, which kind of parts are best-suited to resin printing, and how these machines differ from filament-based printers.

This class is for ages 16 and up. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian for the full duration of the class, and parent/guardian must approve all equipment use.

posts.title: Synthesizer Mini-Class
posts.subtitle: Bebop to the boolean boogie
posts.description: Learn how to make a basic electronic synthesizer by connecting digital and analog electronic components in ways their designers never intended! Attendees will learn the basics of synthesizers and how they are implemented in this informal class after the regular Tuesday meeting.

posts.title: Intro to CNC Machining
posts.subtitle: Learn to use Hacksburg's CNC gantry router
posts.description:
In part one of our series of CNC classes, attendees will learn how to do basic CNC operations and think like a machinist. Details will be given for the operation of Hacksburg's CNC gantry router, generously donated by Onefinity and Torc Robotics, and we will machine a demonstration part.

This class is for ages 16 and up. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian for the full duration of the class, and parent/guardian must approve all equipment use.

posts.title: Seed Starting and Gardening Basics
posts.subtitle: Learn how to grow your own food
posts.description: Get ready for garden season by learning how to start your own plants from seed. Starting from seed saves money and increases the variety of plants you can grow! This class will also cover basic garden prep information such as mixing soil and making planters. The class fee covers a seed-starting kit and seeds. Feel free to bring your own seeds as well!
